text: José Manuel 'Joseba' Aguado Fernández (born 3 February 1979) is a Spanish football coach, who is currently in charge of CD Huétor Vega. ==Manager career== Born in Granada, Andalusia, Aguado began his managerial career with Vandalia de Peligros CF in Tercera División.Historia (History) ; Vandalia Peligros' official website. Retrieved on 17 March 2015 In 2007, he was appointed manager of CD Huétor Tájar, achieving two consecutive promotions but being sacked on 28 May 2009.Joseba Aguado, destituido en el Huétor (Joseba Aguado, sacked in Huétor); Granada Hoy, 28 May 2009 In September 2009 Aguado was named CD Santa Fe manager, with the side also in the third level.Joseba Aguado se convierte en el nuevo entrenador del CD Santa Fe (Joseba Aguado becomes the new manager of CD Santa Fe); Ideal, 18 September 2009 On 29 June of the following year, after avoiding relegation, he was appointed at the helm of Granada CF B.Joseba Aguado, nuevo entrenador del filial rojiblanco (Joseba Aguado, new manager of the rojiblanco reserves); Granada en Juego, 29 June 2010 Aguado achieved two consecutive promotions with the Rojiblancos, taking the team to Segunda División B for the first time ever and renewing his link on 9 July 2013.Joseba Aguado seguirá como entrenador del Granada B (Joseba Aguado will continue as manager of Granada B); Vavel, 9 July 2013 On 16 January 2015 he was appointed interim manager of the main squad in La Liga, replacing fired Joaquín Caparrós.Comunicado oficial Granada Club de Fútbol (Official announcement Granada Club de Fútbol) ; Granada's official website, 16 January 2015 Aguado appeared in his first professional match two days later, a 0–2 away loss against Atlético Madrid.El Atlético cumple entre copa y copa (Atlético satisfies between cup and cup); Marca, 18 January 2015 On 11 June 2015 he left Granada, after five years in charge of the B-side.Joseba Aguado deja el banquillo de Granada CF “B” (Joseba Aguado leaves the bench of Granada CF "B"); Granada CF, 11 June 2015 On 14 June 2016, Aguado was appointed in charge of UD Maracena.Joseba Aguado, nuevo entrenador de la UD Maracena (Joseba Aguado, new manager of UD Maracena); Ideal, 14 June 2016 ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1969 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Granada Category:Spanish football managers Category:La Liga managers Category:Granada CF managers
title: Joseba Aguado
